ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I became a better writer, improved my close reading skills, became a closer and faster reader, learned how to do research in the humanities, and how to craft a thoughtful argument around a larger scholarly topic.
What I learned the most was to be mindful and considerate of other people.

I became such a better reader, writer, and conversationalist through this class. I built confidence in discussing difficult readings and connecting our readings to broader topics related to presence, mindfulness, and belonging.
I was able to think about both contemporary issues and philosophical ideas critically.

I LEARNED SO MUCH! My life will quite literally not be the same after taking this class. Not only did I get better writing skills and learn how to write a variety of complex papers, I also left the class with so many insights about the world and society.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I found Helen to be a great instructor and thought she did a great job leading our discussions. I also found the feedback after each submission for an essay, outline, etc. to be extremely helpful and clear. She always gave me some bigger idea to chew on and make my essay substantially more engaging/stronger. The readings were also phenomenally interesting, especially if you are into mindfulness.
it is really good but some of the instructions for the paper were broad

Strengths: Helen!!! She is so amazing, friendly, interesting, and generous. I also thought the topic in general was a strength, as it made me feel very grounded and grateful in a difficult semester. Also, the other students in the class came to become people I would consider good friends.
Weaknesses: some of the readings were a little dry, and some of the essay prompts (P1 and P2 especially) were a little confusing
Everything was great about this class. My favorite class so far.

The in-class discussions were vibrant thanks to Helen's amazing choice of readings and procter questions. A times the readings were quite long but definitely worth it. The essay prompts were engaging and open ended which allowed me to be very creative.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would absolutely recommend this course. It was a great way to improve my writing skills at the start of college, had very interesting readings of a reasonable length, and was a fun class where I found that I was surrounded by friends towards the end of the semester.

Yes, yes, yes! Absolutely take this course. It is an amazing introduction into college level writing. Unfortunately, this was Helens last semester at Yale, so she wont be teaching this course anymore, but TAKE ENGLISH 114. You will not regret it.
yes!!! The best class ever, Helen is an amazing professor.
For sure!!! I learned so much and had an amazing experience in the class.
